memory_verse.label: Memory Verse
memory_verse.text: “I poured out my soul before the Lord.”  ( 1 Samuel 1:15 )

devotion.label: Insight / Reflection
devotion.text:
Hannah was a woman of deep sorrow. The shame of barrenness and the mockery of others wounded her spirit. Even her husband’s tender love could not console her. But one day, she rose up in holy determination and poured out her heart before God. Her tearful prayer became a covenant: “If You give me a son, I will give him back to You.”

God heard the cry that came from her depths. The answer was the prophet Samuel. True to her vow, Hannah surrendered him completely to God’s service. Heaven rejoiced, for a new voice was born to speak God’s word in a silent nation.
In those days, no one was ready to listen to God — but now He had found a new young friend to speak His heart. God’s joy was great, for Hannah’s poured-out heart had given heaven a voice on earth.

When God saw Hannah’s sincerity, He turned her pain into prophetic purpose and her tears into triumph. That same God still watches your heart. When you pray with faith and surrender like Hannah, He will open closed doors, lift your reproach, and fill you with divine joy. Hanna’s Bliss can be yours too — when your heart truly pours out before Him.

quote.label: Today's Quote
quote.text: “The tears of a praying mother are the seed of revival.” – Charles Spurgeon

prayer.label: Prayer
prayer.text: Lord, when life wounds me, teach me to pour my heart at Your feet. Turn my tears into testimony, and my sorrow into song. Let my answered prayers glorify You and bless generations. Amen.

conclusion.label: A Word to You
text: May the Lord who remembered Hannah remember you. As you pour out your heart in faith, may heaven respond with joy, and may your life overflow with Hanna’s Bliss, the joy of answered prayer.
